resources.string:
Load Model

Load the samples included with the app (Samples), github repository (Repository) or download them to your device and open it (using File or Android Explorer)

Supported formats

Only wavefront, stereolithography or Collada files (*.obj, *.stl, *.dae) are currently supported.

Demo

Example scene using the API. It loads several models using different draw modes, colors, textures, etc.

Renderer

Once you load a model, you can pinch to zoom, translate the camera with your finger and rotate the screen with 2 fingers

Toolbar

In the action bar you will also find several buttons for toggling different draw modes like wireframe or points, enabling or disabiling lights, textures or animation.

Troubleshooting

If the model file (.obj) is referencing any materials file (*.mtl) be sure its in the same folder; same applies for texture files (*.jpg, *.bmp) being referenced in the material file.

If you need more help or have any issue feel free to open a ticket in github or ask me. Thank you in advance for your feedback.

andresoviedo@gmail.com

This application allows you to load 3D object models (currently only Wavefront, Stereolithography and Collada formats are supported).

The purpose of this application is to learn how to draw in android using the OpenGL 2.0 language.

The code for this application is open source and it can be found at https://github.com/the3deer/android-3D-model-viewer

As this is my first android app and Im still learning the OpenGL 2.0 language, it is highly probable that there are bugs; but I will try to continue improving the app.

The included models in the app were taken for free from Internet.

This application does not collect or make use of any kind of personal information.

Any comments, suggestions, contributions, complains or donations are welcome. Feel free to contact me at andresoviedo@gmail.com.
